On Aug 15, 2007, at 6:57 AM, William Monti wrote:

> I've been away from the list for some time, but there is a nice  
> approach that is to use HSL values instead of RGB in order to  
> achieve more "natural" colors, and other types of functions instead  
> of the default ones. That is the idea behind the JCPPN project, I  
> still need time to build the website, but there are some images  
> generated by it at:https://sourceforge.net/project/screenshots.php? 
> group_id=173930

Those are cool images William, and I agree, HSV/HSL is probably more  
sensible than RGB.
--
Stephen Waits
steve@...
http://swaits.com/



--Apple-Mail-2-575952454
